column4: ehlo....question for anyone Dualbooted Ubuntu and OS X....accessing other hdds from other OS...possible?
OS X didnt see ubuntu partitions real well, and i dont/cant access my HFS+ Drives from Ubuntu :S
for OS X you need something that can read ext2.. I've got something installed for that, don't remember the name
linux can read hfsplus, but i don't know if it's enabled in the ubuntu kernel..
you sure you've got the right hdX
i did a 'fdisk -l hd<x> to find the proper Sizes...so yeah
one of the -smp ones
i've got debian on mine, but that's mostly the same
in ubuntu mmb and rmb are f11 and f12 by default iirc
have you got a regular mac mouse? im tryin to rightclick in Firefox to save/get wallpapers...
yeah apple mouse (well apple trackpad :)
any clue on how to tweak either the KB or the apple pro mouse settings to make it Right Click?
does cat /proc/sys/dev/mac_hid/mouse_button_emulation  output 1 for you ?
and cat /proc/sys/dev/mac_hid/mouse_button3_keycode
that's F12, so F12 should do rmb for you
you are the master.....TY
you ever do a kernel compile to use as virtual terminal?
don't understand what you mean, sorry
a buddy of mine compiled up a slack kernel to use as an emulation of slack on his gentoo box : was just curious if you'd heard of anyone doing that...
an emulation of slack ?
basically...to build off the kernel within his system
you mean UML ?
never used it
cool...just checking : ty
